item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 19, 2025 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Using your Apple device as an access card in unsupported systems (15 points | 1 comment)
2. The surprising struggle to get a Unix Epoch time from a UTC string in C or C++ (12 points | 3 comments)
3. Robotics and ROS 2 Essentials (25 points | 5 comments)
4. Making glow-in-the-dark Strontium Aluminate (53 points | 21 comments)
5. The Fuzzing Book (61 points | 2 comments)
6. Forgejo: A self-hosted lightweight software forge (271 points | 205 comments)
7. Build a Database in 3000 Lines with 0 Dependencies (158 points | 9 comments)
8. Zuckerberg appeared to know Llama trained on Libgen (19 points | 5 comments)
9. GauntletAI (YC S17) will fly you out, train you to build w AI, give you 200k job ( | hide)
10. Haskell: A Great Procedural Language (170 points | 109 comments)
11. How hard would it be to display the contents of an image file on the screen? (99 points | 35 comments)
12. “The Traitors”, a reality TV show, offers a useful economics lesson (85 points | 70 comments)
13. GitHub introduces sub-issues, issue types and advanced search (232 points | 131 comments)
14. About A comprehensive guide for Linux Network (Socket) programming (33 points | 5 comments)
15. VS Code Pets (468 points | 121 comments)
16. How Unix spell ran in 64kb RAM (196 points | 35 comments)
17. Strontium isoscape of sub-Saharan Africa allows tracing slave trade (2024) (4 points | discuss)
18. Rust: Investigating an Out of Memory Error (78 points | 25 comments)
19. Calculator Forensics (2002) (9 points | discuss)
20. The "35-cent" Commodore 64 softmodem (94 points | 11 comments)
21. Yek: Serialize your code repo (or part of it) to feed into any LLM (133 points | 56 comments)
22. Lenovo has removed the TrackPoint nub from new ThinkPad laptops (51 points | 80 comments)
23. Show HN: Interactive systemd – a better way to work with systemd units (486 points | 188 comments)
24. A System for the Sixties-and-a-Half: The Toshiba Visicom COM-100 (21 points | 1 comment)
25. TikTok says it is restoring service for U.S. users (38 points | 55 comments)
26. IsMyXFeedFucked – Analyze How Your X Feed's Impacting You (31 points | 65 comments)
27. Book and Dagger: How scholars and librarians became spies during World War II (48 points | 34 comments)
28. 'Once-in-a-century' discovery reveals luxury of Pompeii (111 points | 71 comments)
29. We need to protect the protocol that runs Bluesky (110 points | 162 comments)
30. What Roman Coins Reveal About the People Who Made Them (11 points | 1 comment)
